news_header: The Helsinki Stock Exchange rose by 0.44%, with Nokia's shares increasing by 0.7%. CEO Pekka Lundmark will leave, and Justin Hotard will take over in 2025. Other companies like Machine and Fortum also saw gains, while Sampo and Stora Enso fell. Oma Savings Bank reported stronger results but faced investigations.
news_original_title: Helsingin pörssissä nousupäivä – Nokian osake päivän vaihdetuin
news_text: On Monday, the Helsinki Stock Exchange experienced a rise of 0.44%, closing at 10,123.20 points. Nokia's shares increased by 0.7%, with significant trading activity. CEO Pekka Lundmark announced his departure, with Justin Hotard set to take over in 2025. Other companies such as Machine, Fortum, and Neste also saw gains, while Sampo and Stora Enso experienced declines. Oma Savings Bank reported better-than-expected results but is under investigation for previous losses. Investors House improved its performance and increased its dividend for the tenth consecutive time. Metso announced an investment in its screening business in China, and the Maritime Aura Group is forming a joint venture with a Ukrainian AI specialist to enhance defense capabilities. BBS-Bioactive Bone Substitutes is seeking additional funding and exploring strategic financing options.
